    • Field Detail

      • nComponents

        int nComponents
        the number of components requested from the calculation, that is, the first p principal components from the U matrix of the SVD decomposition of the covariance of x. NOTE that x given to the algorithm, is a sample of vectors {⃗x_j}_{j=1 to k}, with each ⃗x_j ∈ R^n (each x_j is a vector of n real numbers) that form the matrix X ∈ R^(nxk). .

      • principalDirections

        double[][] principalDirections
        the first nComponents principal directions of x. this is obtained from the first p columns of the U matrix of SVD(cov(x)). the U_p columns have been transposed into rows here: principalDirections[0] holds 1st principal direction, principalDirections[1] holds 2nd principal direction, etc. 
            x * principalDirections * v^T_p gives the principal axes which
       minimize the variance.

      • vTP

        double[][] vTP
        the first p rows of the V^T matrix of SVD(cov(x)). 
            x * principalDirections * v^T_p gives the principal axes which
       minimize the variance.

      • fractionVariance

        double fractionVariance
        the fraction of the total variance Q_p (where p is the dimension number, that is, nComponents): 
            Q_p = (SSD_0 − SSD_p)/SSD_0
 
    where SSD_p = summation_{j=p+1 to n}(s_j)
       where s_j is from the diagonal matrix S of the SVD
          of the covariance of x.

      • cumulativeProportion

        double[] cumulativeProportion
        the cumulative addition of (sum_of_eigenvalues - eigenvalue_i)/sum_of_eigeneigenvalues

      • ssdP

        double ssdP
        Minimum residual variance

      • s

        double[] s
        the first nComponents singular values from the diagonal matrix of the SVD of covariance of x;

      • eigenvalues

        double[] eigenvalues

    • Constructor Detail

      • PCAStats

        public PCAStats()
